intro: Albizia idiopoda, commonly known as the African lady's-tresses, is a flowering plant native to Africa. It is a perennial herb that grows up to 1 meter in height, characterized by its erect stems and pinnately compound leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Albizia idiopoda is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or grassland habitats. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in some African cultures.
